author: Yahoo Finance
title: Romanian General Staff chief says Putin will not stop and calls to prepare for war with Russia
text:
Ukrayinska Pravda Romanian General Staff chief says Putin will not stop and calls to prepare for war with Russia Ukrainska Pravda February 1, 2024 at 9:06 PM · 1 min read 3 Link Copied Read full article Stock photo: Getty Images
Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below
General Gheorghiță Vlad, Romania's Deputy Chief of Defence Staff, believes that the Romanian people, like all Europeans, should prepare for the potential spread of Russian aggression, which Putin will escalate if he wins in Ukraine.
Source: Gheorghiță Vlad in an interview with the Romanian service of Radio Liberty on 1 February, reports European Pravda
Details: Vlad emphasised that Russia "has become a problem for the world order and for democracy," and thus it is waging war not just against Ukraine but also "with the democratic world." "The population of Romania, like the entire population of the European Union and Europe, should be worried, and we should take appropriate measures to be ready," he said in a statement.
The Romanian General Staff chief emphasised that if Russia wins in Ukraine, it will most likely attack Moldova, escalating the situation in the Western Balkans.
Quote: "I am more than confident that President Putin will escalate in the near future," Vlad said.
The Romanian military leadership urged NATO countries to replenish arms stocks and prepare the population, most likely by instituting voluntary military service for the entire population.
Background:
Similar statements have recently been made by the military leadership of many other countries. For instance, Boris Pistorius, Federal Minister of Defence of Germany, said that Russia might attack a NATO country in the near future.
Swedish Armed Forces Commander-in-Chief Micael Bydén and Minister for Civil Defence Carl-Oskar Bohlin said all citizens should be prepared for war.
And the Commander-in-Chief of Norway's Armed Forces urged not to waste the "window of opportunity" to prepare for a possible direct confrontation with Russia, as this time could be limited in a few years.

author: Dylan McNeill
title: Husband, wife named head coaches for new Corsairs rodeo team
text:
Another stone fell into place after Cal Poly Humboldt and College of the Redwoods launched their plans to introduce rodeo teams to both schools earlier this summer — College of the Redwoods announced their two head coaches on Tuesday, hiring Gianna and Kelly O’Day.
The Corsairs brought on the husband and wife duo to ignite the Corsairs rodeo program, with both O’Days being local rodeo riders.
“The local rodeo community all agreed that Kelly and Gianna were the coaches we needed to secure here at CR,” Ryan Bisio, College of the Redwoods assistant athletic director, said in Tuesday’s release. “Kelly and Gianna’s longstanding connections to local and regional rodeo folks, along with their expertise in successful rodeo programs, will benefit us tremendously.”
Kelly O’Day competed on a college rodeo team while attending Cal Poly San Luis Obispo, competing in the National College Finals twice before moving on to professional rodeo, where he won the Brawley Rodeo in 2016. Coaching isn’t new for the O’Days, with Kelly already serving as an assistant coach on the Ferndale High School football team while also being an agriculture teacher at the school. Both CR and Cal Poly Humboldt will use the facilities at the Ferndale fairgrounds for practice.
“Since I’ve started teaching, I have taken a step back from rodeo, and now that we have accepted this opportunity, I am looking forward to getting back involved in the sport that has defined me for many years,” Kelly O’Day said in the release.
Gianna O’Day has participated in rodeo events at the junior high, high school, collegiate and professional levels. O’Day also attended Cal Poly San Luis Obispo, coming back from an injury in her freshman season where she lost her right thumb tying up a horse. The injury didn’t stop her as she continued her rodeo career and has qualified for the California Circuit Finals for the past two years.
“I am excited to keep rodeo and the cowboy culture alive in Ferndale and the Humboldt County community,” Gianna O’Day said in the school’s release. “I have always enjoyed coaching young adults and look forward to the challenge of developing a rodeo program with my husband at CR.”
Both the Corsairs and the ‘Jacks will begin their rodeo programs this fall, just a few months after the colleges announced the sport’s introduction.
“Bringing rodeo to CR has long been a goal of mine, and I believe the O’Days are the perfect team to help us achieve this vision,” College of the Redwoods President Keith Flamer said in the release. “I am also excited about the opportunities this presents for working with Cal Poly Humboldt to strengthen our connections through our new rodeo programs.”
Corsairs’ wrestling readies for another season After bringing back the College of the Redwoods’ wrestling program in 2023, head coach Brandon Benvenuti and his athletes are ready for year two, which opens up Friday for the men’s team with a free to attend Cardinal vs. Gold inter-squad match Friday night at 5:30 p.m. in the CR gym.
The men’s team finished 12th in the CCCAA state championships last year, an impressive start for the program that was previously dormant for over four decades.
Following Friday’s scrimmage, the season will begin officially later this month with the Sac City Invitational on Sept. 21. After that is the first of four home meets, with the Sierra College Duel on Oct. 2.
Dyaln McNeill can be reached at 707-441-0526.
